title: Trying to join pes and just wanted to know a few things
content:
alright so I've been checking out pes for the last couple of weeks and I'm getting a shitload of mixed reviews from the subreddit. few things I wanna know are:

1. the boys hostel? is it good or bad? is the rules like really strict? 

2. does the college have like a basketball team or is does pes invest itself into sports??

3. lastly just wanna know if u can truly fuck around during ur free time and like do stuff iykwim

comments.body: I can't comment on the boys hostel because I'm a day scholar, yes PES does have a basketball team, I don't know what you mean by "fuck around", if you can be lil more specific about it, but the course is very academically rigorous, you should go through the FAQs written by rowlet and some of the recent posts to get a better understanding of it

been here for around 5 months  
1. boys hostel really chill, love it here u can make friends really easily. strictness yeah i mean the usual, theres timings and certain basic rules but if you follow you'll actually thrive and have fun dw about it  
2. p sure there is a basket ball team, has all sports facilities huge ass cricket ground and really well maintained. i was personally disappointed by the size of football turf but with the right people its still enjoyable.  
3. u can fuck around at ur own expense, if you have a good schedule and are well organized with ur study time then yeah you can spend ur free time while having decent time left for studies(trust me u really need it dont underestimate). also nigga wdym by "do stuff"
I'll check that out thanks
i meant shit like sneaking out of hostel, smoking rules etc etc

0 tolerance bro, if youre caught youre done and i mean why sneak out the timings arent that bad, curfew is at 9pm anyway  
smoking inside isnt allowed but i do occasionally catch the smell still dk where its from

its a good environment when u get used to it

hostel is chill. you can do p much anything u want if u get away with it ( u will if ur careful but I wouldnt recommend you to do anything for your sake ). Curfew is 9 but u can come by 10pm and its all good

The boys hostel at least for first year students is trash idk what chill others talking about. Curfew is not at 9pm its at 7pm. Internet is very inconsistent and the mallus are always screaming for no reason
Bruhh, do your boards and kcet well and go to RV, you don't deserve pes, u deserve better, believe me mann srsly....
yoo actually? im trying for the commerce stream so do you think it's worth joining here?
Most of the ppl messaging here r B. Tech ppl not commerce
when u said fucking around i thought u meant like working on projects and stuff T-T,
dumb logic, he should go to MIT, he deserves better.

Hi, fellow freshman here.
I'm from the ec campus so my views are largely on the ec campus (hostels are nearly same in both campuses) , so the basketball part is a bit biased.

- Hostel is pretty mid here but the food is better than other PUC hostels in Karnataka as I hear from my mates and friends.
Like the beds are absolute trash, the wifi is awful (don't expect it to work at all except for midnight and the sleeping hours)
You get half a cupboard each for 4 sharing rooms with less space but honestly it's fine if you can adjust.
The washrooms are fine (iykyk üíÄ)

- when I visited rr campus their hostel (3 sharing is actually p decent (contrasting with ec hostel) for all 3 years, 4th yr doesn't have hostel in both campuses)

For boys hostel it's actually pretty chill (yup, the warden doesn't care lmfao) alongside the rough curfew timings (7:00 for boys and 6:30 for girls) 
For girls hostel @ (ec hostel)  the rules are actually pretty strict and regular room checking and all (even cupboard checking) is done and a


Some ass laundry service is here for all year of hostel students  though they aren't that bad but yk... üôÇ)

-while I come to hear there's a separate app for seniors in ec (and maybe rr aswell) I'm not very sure so someone can probably help you there)

-  academics is next level here. some incredible level of regular study is needed to even get good (~8 sgpa (semester gpa) and above) and last minute studies never work here (abhi L lage hai yaar ‚ò†Ô∏è)
Like you need uhh pretty good consistency to score good in your (ISAs) mid sems (in semester assessment) and assignments and lab shi and ofc the ESAs (end sem)


[EC]
- While there is a basketball team most of the time on the basketball court you're gonna see people sitting on the audience area and eating food but yeah people do play. (Like specifics are limited with me sorry )

[RR]
- 3 courts there in sports area and actually very well maintained so it looks like good activity goes on there.


Some more info will be like
Good wifi in pes campus, yup sophos firewall restrictions are there, so don't try downloading games on vpn (friend got blocked off pes wifi lmfaoo)
It's good if you join from kcet else it's just not worth bro¬†
damn thanks for elaborate explanation lmao, really helps
ahh, alr alr... so ig commerce doesn't have enough attention at this place yea?
can u clarify why kcet specifically? does it make any difference if you join the same college through different entrance exams?
Ya lol...
I mean,if you work hard here with like 9.5 CGPA + then def worth it....you can pursue MBA and all later and PES will give you a slight upper hand...if you want to go to abroad any......

Yes through kcet your fees is very less and the return on your fees is really good. Through pessat or jee you have to pay too much fees and the return is not that good considering high fees. You may think fees is not a factor for you but paying high fees and running in a rat race again after jee is stupid. The academics need jee level of preparation and because you pay high fees the pressure on you to perform well is really high. So for your mental and financial well-being join only through kcet
ohkay thanksss ! :) ( not from karnantaka so cant give kcetüòî)
Try other clgs bro, pes thru high fees is not worth it.¬†
